episodeTitle: The Assassins Attack! The Great Battle Above the Ice Begins
japaneseTi: 襲い来る刺客たち！氷上大バトル開始
romanizedTitle: Osoi Kuru Shikaku-tachi! Hyōjō Dai Batoru Kaishi
description: The Straw Hat crew splits up across the frozen Hyokaido archipelago as they pursue the Accino Family bounty hunters who stole their Jolly Roger. Nami and Franky explore underwater and discover penguins moving icebergs, Usopp and Sanji encounter a married couple of assassins, Luffy and Chopper fight alongside the Phoenix Pirates, Robin meets young Lil, and Zoro discovers the mysterious Lovely Land headquarters.

events.title: Nami and Franky Explore Underwater with Shark Submerge III
events.description: Nami and Franky use the Shark Submerge III submarine to investigate underwater beneath the icebergs of Hyokaido. They discover that Domo Penguins are physically pushing and moving the massive icebergs from below the water's surface.
events.significance: Reveals the mechanism behind the Accino Family's trap - the seemingly random iceberg movements are actually controlled by penguins, allowing the bounty hunters to corner their prey.

quotes.text: So that's how they're moving the icebergs! It's penguins!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Discovering the Domo Penguins pushing icebergs underwater

events.title: Hockera's First Appearance
events.description: Hockera, the third son of the Accino Family, makes his first appearance by attacking Nami and Franky as they surface from their underwater investigation. He fights using hockey-themed combat techniques and commands an army of Domo Penguins.
events.significance: Introduces one of the main antagonists of the Ice Hunter Arc and demonstrates the Accino Family's fighting styles based on ice sports.

quotes.text: You'll make a fine present for Papa! Kekeke!
quotes.speaker: Hockera

events.title: Franky vs Hockera Begins
events.description: Franky engages Hockera in battle, declaring he will take on the hockey-themed fighter. Hockera uses his freezing ice pucks as weapons, while Franky counters with his cyborg abilities and weaponry.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of individual battles between the Straw Hats and Accino Family members across Hyokaido.

events.title: Usopp and Sanji Knocked Off the Thousand Sunny
events.description: Usopp and Sanji are knocked off the Thousand Sunny by a sudden iceberg collision, separating them from the ship and forcing them to navigate the frozen terrain alone.
events.significance: Further divides the Straw Hat crew, setting up individual encounters with different Accino Family members.

events.title: Salchow and Arbell's First Appearance
events.description: The married couple Salchow and Arbell, members of the Accino Family, make their first appearance as they encounter Usopp and Sanji. The figure skating-themed duo are extremely affectionate toward each other, constantly expressing their love.
events.significance: Introduces two antagonists whose fighting style is based on figure skating, continuing the ice sports theme of the Accino Family. Their over-the-top romantic behavior provides comic relief.

events.title: Sanji's Reaction to the Loving Couple
events.description: Sanji becomes annoyed and frustrated watching Salchow and Arbell's constant displays of affection, finding their romantic behavior irritating rather than endearing.
events.significance: Provides character comedy and sets up the dynamic for their upcoming battle.

events.title: Brindo's First Appearance
events.description: Brindo, one of the Accino twin brothers, makes his first appearance by attacking Luffy, Chopper, and the Phoenix Pirates. He demonstrates the twins' unique magnetic combination ability.
events.significance: Introduces another Accino Family member and showcases their supernatural magnetic powers.

events.title: Luffy and Chopper Fight Brindo with Phoenix Pirates
events.description: Luffy and Chopper, alongside members of the Phoenix Pirates crew, engage in battle against Brindo. The fight showcases Brindo's acrobatic abilities and magnetic powers.
events.significance: Demonstrates the temporary alliance between the Straw Hats and Phoenix Pirates against their common enemy.

events.title: Lil's First Appearance
events.description: Lil, the youngest daughter of the Accino Family, makes her first appearance by approaching Nico Robin on the Thousand Sunny. She presents herself as an innocent little girl wanting to play.
events.significance: Introduces the youngest Accino family member, who uses her appearance of innocence to deceive opponents. Sets up her interaction with Robin.

events.title: Lil Asks Robin to Play
events.description: Lil approaches Robin with a seemingly innocent request to play together, calling her 'big sister.' Robin, though cautious, shows some compassion toward the young girl.
events.significance: Establishes the deceptive nature of Lil's character and her loneliness within the Accino Family, particularly her jealousy of her sister's husband Salchow.

events.title: Zoro Discovers Lovely Land
events.description: Roronoa Zoro stumbles upon Lovely Land, the golden castle headquarters of the Accino Family hidden deep within Hyokaido. The castle has an unexpected tropical atmosphere due to Don Accino's heat-generating Devil Fruit powers.
events.significance: Reveals the main base of operations for the antagonists and sets the stage for the climactic confrontation. The discovery of this location marks a turning point in the arc.

events.title: Luffy Learns Flag Was Taken to Lovely Land
events.description: Luffy discovers from the conversation with the Accino Family members that the stolen Straw Hat Jolly Roger has been taken to Lovely Land, Don Accino's fortress where he keeps his collection of pirate flags.
events.significance: Establishes the crew's goal and destination for the arc's climax - infiltrating Lovely Land to reclaim their flag.

events.title: Luffy Decides to Confront the Accino Family
events.description: After learning the location of their stolen flag, Luffy becomes determined to go to Lovely Land and confront the Accino Family directly to retrieve their Jolly Roger.
events.significance: Sets Luffy's course toward the arc's main conflict with Don Accino.

events.title: The Great Battle on Ice Begins
events.description: With all Straw Hat crew members now engaged with different Accino Family members across Hyokaido, the full-scale battle between the two groups officially begins. The episode ends with multiple simultaneous confrontations taking place across the frozen archipelago.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the arc's major conflict, with each Straw Hat matched against an Accino Family member in separate battles that will continue in subsequent episodes.

quotes.text: So that's how they're moving the icebergs! It's penguins!
quotes.speaker: Nami

quotes.text: You'll make a fine present for Papa! Kekeke!
quotes.speaker: Hockera

themes.description: Despite being separated across Hyokaido, each Straw Hat fights their individual battles with the same determination to retrieve their precious Jolly Roger.
themes.symbolism: The scattered crew represents how even when divided, the Straw Hats remain united in purpose and spirit.

themes.description: The episode reinforces the importance of the Jolly Roger as more than just a flag - it's a symbol of the crew's identity and dreams worth fighting for.
themes.symbolism: The Jolly Roger represents the crew's pride, unity, and their declaration to the world of who they are.

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates her analytical skills by investigating the iceberg movements underwater and quickly deducing the Accino Family's strategy.
keyActions: Explores underwater with Shark Submerge III
quotes: So that's how they're moving the icebergs! It's penguins!

characterSpotlights.development: Shows his versatility by piloting the Shark Submerge III and then immediately engaging in combat with Hockera.
keyActions: Pilots Shark Submerge III with Nami
Defends against freezing ice puck attacks

characterSpotlights.development: Shows his determination to retrieve the crew's flag and willingness to fight alongside allies (Phoenix Pirates).
keyActions: Fights Brindo with Chopper and Phoenix Pirates
Learns flag location is Lovely Land

characterSpotlights.development: Despite getting separated and lost (as usual), Zoro makes the crucial discovery of Lovely Land's location.

mangaDifferences.difference: This entire episode is anime-only filler content. The Ice Hunter Arc does not exist in the manga.

trivia.fact: The Ice Hunter Arc is the eighth filler arc in One Piece and spans episodes 326-335, making it one of the longest filler arcs in the series.

sources.title: Ice Hunter Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The Accino Family members are all themed after ice sports: Hockera (hockey), Salchow and Arbell (figure skating), while Don Accino's heat powers create an ironic contrast.
Episode 329 aired on November 4, 2007 in Japan with a TV rating of 7.0%, ranking #6 in viewership for that week.
The Shark Submerge III is one of the vehicles from the Thousand Sunny's Soldier Dock System, designed by Franky for underwater exploration with a diving limit of 5,000 meters.

sources.title: Shark Submerge III - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Hyokaido's name is likely a reference to Hokkaido, the northernmost main island of Japan known for its cold climate and winter sports.
The character name 'Salchow' is a direct reference to the Salchow jump in figure skating, named after Swedish skater Ulrich Salchow.
